docs.lead_paragraph: With sign-up season starting in less than two weeks, the Obama administration indicated on Monday that some long-awaited upgrades to the government's health insurance website could take more time before they're customer-ready.

headline.main: Potential Delay on Some Upgrades to Gov't Insurance Site
headline.print_headline: Potential Delay on Some Upgrades to Gov't Insurance Site

docs.snippet: With sign-up season starting in less than two weeks, the Obama administration indicated on Monday that some long-awaited upgrades to the government's health insurance website could take more time before they're customer-ready.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge granted a procedural victory Monday to House Republicans using the courts to attack President Barack Obama's health care law, denying an Obama administration request for a quick appeal of a recent ruling in the case.

headline.main: Judge: No Quick Appeal in House Lawsuit Over Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Judge: No Quick Appeal in House Lawsuit Over Health Care Law

docs.snippet: A federal judge granted a procedural victory Monday to House Republicans using the courts to attack President Barack Obama's health care law, denying an Obama administration request for a quick appeal of a recent ruling in the case.

docs.lead_paragraph: The math is harsh: The federal penalty for having no health insurance is set to jump to $695, and the Obama administration is being urged to highlight that cold fact in its new pitch for health law sign-ups.

headline.main: A Health Law Fine on the Uninsured Will More Than Double
headline.print_headline: A Health Law Fine on the Uninsured Will More Than Double

docs.snippet: The math is harsh: The federal penalty for having no health insurance is set to jump to $695, and the Obama administration is being urged to highlight that cold fact in its new pitch for health law sign-ups.

docs.lead_paragraph: Previously excluded from marriage, some gay people adopted their partner for legal protection. But what happens to these adoptions now that same-sex marriage is legal?

headline.main: The Lost History of Gay Adult Adoption

docs.snippet: Previously excluded from marriage, some gay people adopted their partner for legal protection. But what happens to these adoptions now that same-sex marriage is legal?

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

docs.lead_paragraph: Many people who committed minor offenses are blocked from employment and other basic rights for years afterward.

headline.main: How to Get Around a Criminal Record
headline.print_headline: How to Get Around a Criminal Record

docs.abstract: Editorial lauds Judge John Gleeson of Federal District Court in Brooklyn for expunging conviction of woman he had sentenced to five years probation for fraud, stating in his ruling that he had not intended to sentence her to lifetime of unemployment and inability to support her family; argues for judge-issued certificates of rehabilitation and resurgence of pardons as ways to decrease burden of criminal record for those who have paid their debt to society for minor offenses.
docs.snippet: Many people who committed minor offenses are blocked from employment and other basic rights for years afterward.

docs.lead_paragraph: Wright has had a vexing postseason thus far. In the Mets’ first six games, Wright, a career .298 hitter, was 1 for 19 with eight strikeouts.

headline.main: A Hopeful David Wright Conjures Up a Hit
headline.print_headline: A Hopeful Wright Conjures Up a Hit

docs.abstract: New York Mets third baseman David Wright, who is 1 for 19 with eight strikeouts in postseason, comes back from slump in Game 2 of National League Championship Series against Chicago Cubs.
docs.snippet: Wright has had a vexing postseason thus far. In the Mets’ first six games, Wright, a career .298 hitter, was 1 for 19 with eight strikeouts.

byline.contributor: Tim Rohan and Tyler Kepner contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: This week, several major tech companies will release earnings reports, the N.H.T.S.A. will address the safety risks involving faulty Takata airbags, and Aetna and Humana will vote on a proposed merger.

docs.lead_paragraph: Egyptian voters began heading to the polls Sunday to elect a parliament, the first since the military-led ouster of Islamist President Mohammed Morsi in 2013.
